project.teaser: The aim of the MSCAdvocacy project is to provide direct support to better align MSCA cooperation mechanisms of 20 key partner countries and 6 regions with the European Commission’s Global Approach to Research and Innovation. The project will become the strategic link between...
project.objective: The aim of the MSCAdvocacy project is to provide direct support to better align MSCA cooperation mechanisms of 20 key partner countries and 6 regions with the European Commission’s Global Approach to Research and Innovation. The project will become the strategic link between 1) the European Union’s external policy objectives, 2) bilateral and bi-regional S&T agreements with key partner countries and regions, 3) the corresponding R&I cooperation roadmaps and action plans, and 4) MSCA promotion in the field. With MSCA being the central international component of Horizon Europe (HE), its researcher mobility programmes directly contribute to the objective of the EC’s Global Approach such as strengthening commitment to international openness and fundamental values, rebalancing towards a level playing field and reciprocity, ensuring a free exchange of ideas and fostering research in key areas such as a green transition, the digital transition, global health, and innovation. However, in several key partner countries and regions MSCA do not seem to reach their full strategic potential in line with the objectives mentioned above. Hence, the project will do its part in supporting the strategic alignment of participation and cooperation mechanisms for MSCA to the priorities set on policy level. This will be achieved by 1) reviewing broader policy orientations and monitoring existing cooperation mechanisms with the target countries and regions relevant for MSCA; 2) conducting a Coordination and Support Mission to the targeted countries and regions in order to promote MSCA cooperation opportunities; 3) adressing analyses, reviews, and policy briefs to bilateral and bi-regional R&I policy dialogues; 4) and providing recommendations for long-term strategic promotion in MSCA consistent with EU R&I bilateral and bi-regional cooperation roadmaps and action plans.
project.title: International Advocacy for the Strategic Alignment of MSCA Cooperation Mechanisms in Key Partner Countries and Regions
project.keywords: MSCA, International Cooperation, R&I Policy Dialogues, National Contact Points, Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions, R&I Cooperation Action Plans and Roadmaps

article.title: Unleashing the full research and innovation potential of Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - MSCAdvocacy (International Advocacy for the Strategic Alignment of MSCA Cooperation Mechanisms in Key Partner Countries and Regions)
result.teaser: The aim of the MSCAdvocacy project was to contribute to a more strategic promotion of the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA) in 20 target countries (Algeria, Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Chile, China, Egypt, India, Japan, Jordan, Republic of Korea, Mexico...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Analysis of consistency of the MSCA promotion and implementation plans with the EU's R&I bilateral and bi-regional cooperation roadmaps and action plans, including recommendations
result.description: This report will draw its basis on the work from- WT1.1 Assessment of cooperation trends; - WT1.2 Review of cooperation mechanisms;- WT1.4 Qualitative monitoring of participation in MSCA calls); - WT2.2 co-designed activities- WT2.3 Implementation of MSCA promotion activities,- all other tasks in WP3.The report will include recommendations for strategic orientations in the promotion of MSCA; for a coherent long-term promotion plan to implement; for widening MSCA global country networks and for the sustainability of that approach beyond the project’s lifetime. In the last year of the project, preliminary results will be presented to the respective policy dialogue fora (WT3.1), while the report will be submitted at the end of the project, incorporating a feedback from these fora.

result.title: Country/Region Specific R&I Cooperation Assessment Reports
result.description: CountrySpecific Reports which look at the ongoing stateof theart for policy support to bilateralbiregional cooperation relevant for MSCAassessing main cooperation trends opportunities and challenges related to local developments in the RIhigher education domainidentifying possible gaps versus joint priorities and participation of prominent local stakeholders strategic networks associations etc that are part of the RI value chains assessing the main existing ST cooperation agreements and roadmaps and action plans at bilateral and biregional levels for the targeted countries and regionsThis will lay the basis for the crosscutting activity of analysing consistency with EU RI bilateral and biregional activities in WT34

result.title: Collection of MSCA Promotion Plans (2nd Update)
result.description: This collection will entail: - Screening and collecting data about already scheduled MSCA promotion and support activities or/and events (bilateral/regional/local level) in cooperation with existing initiatives and networks such as info relays (e.g. MSCA NCPs network coordination project, EURAXESS WW, national and international university associations, EU Delegations/S&T counsellors, MSC Alumni Association, Chambers of commerce and business associations, etc.). In addition, the synergies with other promotion events and activities related to Horizon Europe, including ERC, COST, and other EU programmes (e.g., Erasmus+, European Enterprise Network, EuropeAid-Technical Assistance, Cooperation with thematic NCPs and other) will be considered. - Mapping (through desk research, interviews, etc.) of untapped promotion opportunities for MSCA, (Congresses, workshops, ‘Open Doors’ in Universities and Research Centers, etc.) along with the relevant strategic networks and stakeholders in order to create synergies with them.This deliverable was due in month 27; it is now put on month 24 in accordance with the pertinent calls of the EC.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This is the dedicated mandatory Data Management PlanThe Data Management Plan DMP describes the data management procedures for all data to be collected processed andor generated in the framework of MSCAdvocacy in line with the Guidelines on FAIR Data Management in Horizon Europe The term FAIR describes a set of guiding principles to make data Findable Accessible Interoperable and Reusable The DMP is part of the necessary information to take part in the European Commissions Open Research Data Pilot

result.title: Collection of MSCA Promotion Plans (1st Update)
result.description: This collection will entail Screening and collecting data about already scheduled MSCA promotion and support activities orand events bilateralregionallocal level in cooperation with existing initiatives and networks such as info relays eg MSCA NCPs network coordination project EURAXESS WW national and international university associations EU DelegationsST counsellors MSC Alumni Association Chambers of commerce and business associations etc In addition the synergies with other promotion events and activities related to Horizon Europe including ERC COST and other EU programmes eg Erasmus European Enterprise Network EuropeAidTechnical Assistance Cooperation with thematic NCPs and other will be considered Mapping through desk research interviews etc of untapped promotion opportunities for MSCA Congresses workshops Open Doors in Universities and Research Centers etc along with the relevant strategic networks and stakeholders in order to create synergies with themThis deliverable was due in month 15 it is now put on month 12 in accordance to the pertinent calls of the EC

result.title: E&D&C Strategy
result.description: The strategy will include clear indicators target groups means to reach those target groups and all the planned promotional actions to be developed for the project activities Exploitation will be built strategically upon the communication and dissemination activities and will have a broader scope to ensure an ongoing validation of project assets throughout the project and to further concretise the value and impact of the project results The countrysensitive approach in coherence with the country liaison system will be put in placeThis deliverable will be redone in better quality

result.title: Report on Qualitative monitoring of participation in MSCA calls
result.description: Collecting data from eCorda CORDIS Horizon DashboardPooling of MSCA participation data and RI fields by country and regional level Desk research and Data Analysis Further Dashboard information MSCA Dashboard as soon as available

result.title: Final Exploitation and Dissemination Report
result.description: This plan fine-tunes the strategy made in M6 and develop it further as a product to be used.It will include clear indicators, target groups, means to reach those target groups, and all the planned promotional actions to be developed for the project activities. Exploitation will be built strategically upon the communication and dissemination activities and will have a broader scope to ensure an ongoing validation of project assets throughout the project, and to further concretise the value and impact of the project results. The country-sensitive approach in coherence with the country liaison system will be put in place.

result.title: MSCA Training Toolbox for multipliers and info-relays
result.description: This Toolbox will contain all necessary practical knowledge and tools for organising training sessions together with NCPs local MSCA Info Sessions and MSCA Grant Writing Workshops for their stakeholdersThis deliverable will be redone in better quality

result.title: Report on Implementation of the MSCA promotion events and ad-hoc events
result.description: The report will include the results from implementation on- ad-hoc events in the target countries (e.g. co-designed workshops)- regional MSCA online promotion events - the dedicated event “International MSCA exchange workshop”.

result.title: Promotion Materials for MSCA information relays, networks, stakeholders and others
result.description: Tailormade promotion materials for the individual target groups from the countryliaision system This includes materials for press media action such associal media mass media and website channels through videos posts photos press releases newsletters and leaflets around major MSCA promotion activities and eventsThis deliverable will be redone in better quality

result.title: Collection of MSCA Promotion Plans
result.description: This collection will entail Screening and collecting data about already scheduled MSCA promotion and support activities orand events bilateralregionallocal level in cooperation with existing initiatives and networks such as info relays eg MSCA NCPs network coordination project EURAXESS WW national and international university associations EU DelegationsST counsellors MSC Alumni Association Chambers of commerce and business associations etc In addition the synergies with other promotion events and activities related to Horizon Europe including ERC COST and other EU programmes eg Erasmus European Enterprise Network EuropeAidTechnical Assistance Cooperation with thematic NCPs and other will be considered Mapping through desk research interviews etc of untapped promotion opportunities for MSCA Congresses workshops Open Doors in Universities and Research Centers etc along with the relevant strategic networks and stakeholders in order to create synergies with themThis deliverable was due im monthe 3 and will be redone in better quality in month 10

result.title: Report on Qualitative monitoring of participation in MSCA calls (Update)
result.description: - Collecting data from eCorda, CORDIS, Horizon Dashboard, additional Dashboards (MSCA)- Specific focus on new data related to Horizon Europe - Pooling of MSCA participation data and R&I fields by country- and regional level- Desk research and Data Analysis

result.title: E&D&C Strategy (Update)
result.description: The strategy will include clear indicators, target groups, means to reach those target groups, and all the planned promotional actions to be developed for the project activities. Exploitation will be built strategically upon the communication and dissemination activities and will have a broader scope to ensure an ongoing validation of project assets throughout the project, and to further concretise the value and impact of the project results. The country-sensitive approach in coherence with the country liaison system will be put in place.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
